title: Understanding the MERN Stack
content: The MERN stack is a popular JavaScript stack used for building full-stack web applications. It consists of MongoDB, Express, React, and Node.js.

title: Why Choose Node.js for Backend Development
content: Node.js is a powerful JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine. It is fast, scalable, and ideal for building real-time applications.

title: Introduction to React Hooks
content: React Hooks provide a way to use state and other React features without writing a class. They were introduced in React 16.8.

title: Getting Started with MongoDB
content: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that stores data in flexible, JSON-like documents. It's a great choice for modern web applications.

title: Express.js: The Fast Framework for Node.js
content: Express.js is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.
